summary: In this family comedy, Tommy Ackerman’s life is best traveled in a nice car, and best lived on the back nine closing business deals. However, his wife, Grace insists that he spend less time at work and more quality time with their family. Tommy reluctantly agrees to sign them up for Family Camp. What Tommy didn’t count on was being forced to share a yurt at camp with the larger-than-life Eddie Sanders family, especially Eddie, an annoying chiropractor who greets people with adjustments rather than handshakes. Unexpected living conditions and crazy camp competitions reveal both families have flaws. In the end, Tommy and Eddie learn that nothing is more important than family.
notes: Shooting beings April 13, 2020, in OK. See https://actorsaccess.com/projects/?view=breakdowns&breakdown=665989&region=5

summary:
The Bennett-Blatt family does not have much in common with each other as they go through their every day lives in Akron. When a foghorn is heard, the actors break character to have the live-studio audience decide what happens next. 

"JUST ROLL WITH IT takes the standard sitcom format and flips it on its head. The show is a multi-cam sitcom, taped in front of a live studio audience. BUT HERE’S THE CATCH... our STUDIO AUDIENCE GETS TO VOTE ON WHAT’S GOING TO HAPPEN TO THEM throughout the show! Our cast has to JUST ROLL WITH IT and try to make it through whatever our audience throws at them. THIS SHOW IS FILLED WITH UNPREDICTABLE ELEMENTS."
notes:
Multi-cam

The series also stars Tisha Campbell-Martin (“Dr. Ken,” “My Wife and Kids”), Jack Stanton (“The Mick”), Connor Kalopsis (“The Grinder”), Ashley Boettcher (“Lost in Oz”) and Oakley Bull (“Beautiful Boy”).

Multi-cam

summary: A lyrical drama that centers on a 14-year-old prodigy from the projects who is haunted by the death of his closest friend and relied on by his hardworking mother to find a way out of poverty. He must choose between the streets that raised him or the higher education that may offer him a way out. Set in South Florida, the series is inspired by events in Tarell Alvin McCraney's life, and explores childhood trauma and the power of imagination to survive.
notes:
Local Casting Director in FL is Heather Heinz

The film is a day in the life of Philando Castile, his long-time girlfriend Diamond Reynolds and her four-year-old daughter on July 6, 2016. That day ended fatally when Castile was shot by Officer Yanezot at close range seven times, hitting him five times. Castile died at 9:37 p.m. at Hennepin County Medical Center, about 20 minutes after being shot. His girlfriend and her daughter witnessed the murder.
notes: From writer/director Marc Cayce. See https://actorsaccess.com/projects/?view=breakdowns&breakdown=677296 and https://actorsaccess.com/projects/?view=breakdowns&breakdown=677046

htmlSummary: SUMMARY: Inspired by the television series and the feature film, S.W.A.T. stars Shemar Moore as a former Marine and locally born and raised S.W.A.T. sergeant, tasked to run a specialized tactical unit that is the last stop in law enforcement in Los Angeles. Torn between loyalty to where he was raised and allegiance to his brothers in blue, Daniel "Hondo" Harrelson strives to bridge the divide between his two worlds and acclimate to his new duties as the legal guardian of a teenager. Hondo's elite unit includes David "Deacon" Kay, an experienced S.W.A.T. officer and dedicated family man who always puts the team first; Christina "Chris" Alonso, a skilled officer and the team's canine trainer; Dominique Luca, an expert driver who gets them in and out of high risk situations; Victor Tan, who started in the LAPD Hollywood Division and uses his confidential informants in the community to help the team; and Jim Street, the team's cocky newest member who is re-instated to S.W.A.T. after being fired for compromising the unit. Responsible for the management of all Metro Division S.W.A.T. units is Commander Robert Hicks, a senior LAPD official with the Special Operations Bureau. Following Captain Jessica Cortez's departure for the FBI, the Mayor assigns Lieutenant Piper Lynch to S.W.A.T. as a tactical consultant, where she challenges the team's field strategy, which raises questions about her loyalty. With Hondo leading the charge, these dedicated men and women bravely put themselves at risk to protect their community and save lives.

htmlSummary: SUMMARY: Wu-Tang: An American Saga is inspired by “The Wu-Tang Manual” and “Tao of Wu”, and based on the true story of the Wu-Tang Clan. summary: The world of _Fallout_ is one where the future envisioned by Americans in the late 1940s explodes upon itself through a nuclear war in 2077. summary: _Kevin Can F**k Himself_ probes the secret life of a type of woman we all grew up believing we knew: the sitcom wife. It looks to break television convention and ask what the world looks like through her eyes. Alternating between single-camera realism and multi-camera comedy, the formats will inform one another as we imagine what happens when the sitcom wife escapes her confines, and is full of rage.

Action thriller between killers, as Court Gentry (Ryan Gosling) is hunted across the globe by Lloyd Hansen (Chris Evans), a former cohort of Gentry’s at the CIA.
notes:
Start/end dates: 01/18/2021 - 05/19/2021

With Ryan Gosling, Chris Evans. Directors Joe & Anthony Russo. 

“The movie is a real mano a mano between those two great actors who represent two different versions of the CIA, in what it can be, and what it can do,” Anthony Russo told ([Deadline](https://deadline.com/2020/07/netflix-the-gray-man-ryan-gosling-chris-evans-joe-russo-anthony-russo-directing-1202987267/)).

The intention here is to create a new franchise with a James Bond level of scale and a budget upward of $200 million.

htmlSummary: SUMMARY: PRODIGAL SON is a fresh take on a crime franchise with a provocative and outrageous lead character and a darkly comedic tone. A father-son story with a serial-killer twist, it brings family dysfunction to a whole new level.
summary: PRODIGAL SON is a fresh take on a crime franchise with a provocative and outrageous lead character and a darkly comedic tone. A father-son story with a serial-killer twist, it brings family dysfunction to a whole new level.

In the early 1990s, Boston was rife with violent criminals emboldened by local law enforcement agencies in which corruption and racism was the norm – and then it all changed in what was called the “Boston Miracle.” In this fictional account, ADA Decourcy Ward comes from Brooklyn and forms an unlikely alliance with a corrupt yet venerated FBI veteran, Jackie Rohr. Together, they take on a family of armored car robbers in a case that grows to involve, and ultimately subvert, the entire criminal justice system of Boston.
notes:
Production has resumed.

With Kevin Bacon

summary: Written by Ed Solomon, the film is set in 1955 Detroit and centers on a group of small-time criminals who are hired to steal what they think is a simple document. When their plan goes horribly wrong, their search for who hired them – and for what ultimate purpose – weaves them through all echelons of the race-torn, rapidly changing city.
notes: Steven Soderbergh, director. Shooting on-location under strict COVID-19 safety protocols in Detroit.

summary: FLAMIN’ HOT tells the true story of Richard Montanez, the son of a Mexican immigrant, who was a janitor at Frito Lay, when he came up with the idea for Flamin’ Hot Cheetos. notes:
